h4. Problem Analysis
Bamboo is trying to pull the {{EXECUTABLE_ID}} from {{AGENT_ASSIGNMENT}} table which will relate to the build. It looks like the process to delete Build Plans does not clean up any agent dedication for said Build Plan.

Running the query below will show the mapping of the dedicated agent: 
{code:sql}
select * from AGENT_ASSIGNMENT where EXECUTOR_ID = 6291457;
{code}
The {{EXECUTOR_ID}} was retrieved from the first line of the log above.

If the row/s looks good (no nulls or weirdness) then the mapping can be validated with the query below, which should show the renamed plan details:
{code:sql}
select * from AGENT_ASSIGNMENT as a, BUILD as b where a.EXECUTABLE_ID = b.BUILD_ID and a.EXECUTOR_ID = 6291457
{code}
Then, it would be a matter of deleting the records from {{AGENT_ASSIGNMENT}} for the Build Plans that do not exist anymore:
{code:sql}
delete from agent_assignment where assignment_id = 12345;
{code}
Where {{12345}} is the {{assignment_id}} from the first query above that were not returned in the second query above.


h4. Workaround
# Backup Bamboo (precaution)
# Stop Bamboo
# Run the following SQL query to delete assignments that is not pointed to existing entities:
{code:SQL}delete from AGENT_ASSIGNMENT where EXECUTABLE_TYPE in ('PLAN', 'JOB') and EXECUTABLE_ID not in (select B.BUILD_ID from BUILD B);
delete from AGENT_ASSIGNMENT where EXECUTABLE_TYPE = 'PROJECT' and EXECUTABLE_ID not in (select P.PROJECT_ID from PROJECT P);
delete from AGENT_ASSIGNMENT where EXECUTABLE_TYPE = 'ENVIRONMENT' and EXECUTABLE_ID not in (select E.ENVIRONMENT_ID from DEPLOYMENT_ENVIRONMENT E);
delete from AGENT_ASSIGNMENT where EXECUTABLE_TYPE = 'DEPLOYMENT_PROJECT' and EXECUTABLE_ID not in (select P.DEPLOYMENT_PROJECT_ID from DEPLOYMENT_PROJECT P);{code}

fields.summary: Ability to bulk delete plan results

fields.description:
I am developing a bamboo plugin by using Bamboo plugin development kit version : 5.0.4 in which i am using selenium api.
While using HtmlUnitDriver() i am getting Linkage Error, It is suggested to use compile scope for 3rd party dependencies by doing this the SDK will bundle the library into your plugin, and the plugin system will make it available in the plugin classloader when the plugin is started, due to this all the selenium packages that are bundled with our plugin project gets loaded and bamboo container also copies selenium jars to the "C:\atlastutorial\MyPlugin\target\bamboo\home\caches\plugins\felix\felix-cache\bundle90\version0.0\MyPlugin-1.0-SNAPSHOT-tests_1417062276414.jar-embedded\META-INF\lib" directory as it also creates test plugin for the unit tests, gets loaded due to which we get Linkage Error: loader constraint violation. And if we mention “provided” scope in our POM then we get “ClassNotFoundException” because these jars are not provided by the atlassian container.
Can you please export selenium jars?
fields.summary: Problem in using Selenium API while developing a Bamboo Plugin

Can we get Java 8 compilation support in bamboo automated builds so we can target the new AMI
both source and target cannot be java 8

Workaround is to use the Java 8 JDK but compile and target for 7

fields.description:
While configuring a build task, customers might not want to have to select a target platform because they might have some DLLs which build to both x86 and x64 folders. 

When they build through Bamboo they don't get the x86 and x64 folders. Probably this is because they're forced to select a target platform.

This works fine in Visual Studio, but Bamboo currently forces users to select a target platform.
fields.summary: Make Visual Studio task platform independent

fields.description:
As a user tasked with maintaining our Bamboo installation, I should be able to configure a plan to automatically remove branch plans and associated builds based upon branches that no longer exist.

Our main library has lots of short-lived bugfix branches, and smaller hotfix branches with a lifespan of a few hours. These currently need manually clearing out every few hours otherwise the disk space ends up getting filled up very quickly, causing builds to fail.
fields.summary: Dead Branch Auto Deletion
As a plugin developer I want to be able to add menu item to a deployment project  on bamboo UI

fields.description:
I have tests producing files in subdirectories of target (build output) directory. All subdirectories have common prefix, but suffix is generated by the test.

If I have target as location and "someDirPrefix*/**/*.*" as copy pattern, no artifacts get found/matched by Bamboo.

Current workaround, is to nest the generated directories, so they end up in target/someContainerDir/someDirPrefix and then define target/someContainerDir as location and **/*.* as copy pattern.
fields.summary: Artifact copy pattern does not handle asterisk in directory

fields.description: When viewing a deployment release, it shows a tab that lists all the commits and the JIRA issues linked to that release. It will be nice if users can from bamboo click a link that shows all the issues involved in an issue navigator. See the screenshot below: !navigator.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Make the issues linked to a deployment environment accessible from the issue navigator

fields.description:
It will be nice to have all the plan variables listed in the custom run dialog box rather than the user having to select and add the variables one by one.

It shouldn't be a major task as the functionality to add the variables to the page already exists and it's a matter of just calling some function which loops and adds all the plan variables to the custom dialog before the dialog is presented to the user.

Also there is currently no option to define drop down select list for global or plan variables.
fields.summary: List all the plan variables in the "Run Custom" dialog box

fields.description:
I want to be able to deploy exactly the same way to multiple environments; thereby rehearsing the eventual live deployment many times per day.

Currently, all deployment tasks are local to each environment, so if I make a change in one, I either have to:

1. Go through each of my 8 environments, and make exactly the same change, which is highly error prone
2.  Delete 7 of my environments and then clone them all from the one I changed, thereby losing my entire deployment history.

This could be solved either by having a set of common tasks that all deployment environments run, or by introducing task templates.
fields.summary: Common Tasks for Deployment Environments

fields.description:
Using the testng-results.xml example file from http://testng.org/doc/documentation-main.html

The Description of the test is "someDescription2":
{code:xml}
    <test name="test1">
      <class name="com.test.TestOne">
        <test-method status="FAIL" signature="test1()" name="test1" duration-ms="0"
              started-at="2007-05-28T12:14:37Z" description="someDescription2"
              finished-at="2007-05-28T12:14:37Z">
{code}
but Bamboo shows "1"
!testng.png|thumbnail!

After changing both test.name and test-method.name:
{code:xml}
    <test name="test100">
      <class name="com.test.TestOne">
        <test-method status="FAIL" signature="test1()" name="test101" duration-ms="0"
              started-at="2007-05-28T12:14:37Z" description="someDescription2"
              finished-at="2007-05-28T12:14:37Z">
{code}
the Description changes to "101"

Changing test-method.name to "foo123":
{code:xml}
    <test name="test100">
      <class name="com.test.TestOne">
        <test-method status="FAIL" signature="test1()" name="foo123" duration-ms="0"
              started-at="2007-05-28T12:14:37Z" description="someDescription2"
{code}
results in "Foo123" for Description.

Description seems to be deducted from the test-method.name, instead of using test-method.description.
fields.summary: TestNG results page shows incorrect Description

fields.description: Please bake in the functionality provided by https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.edwardawebb.bamboo-group-agent or add support for the plugin.
fields.summary: Add the ability to dedicate builds to a pool of agents

fields.description:
We're sometimes seeing artifacts from successful jobs go missing after re-running the build (failed/incomplete jobs only). We've seen it at least three times now. Bamboo reports that there are no artifacts and when we look on S3 we can see that they are no longer there either.

Example:
https://staging-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/browse/PUPPETCI-PUPPETCD-875/artifact

See attached screenshots for examples.

The example with missing artifacts was re-run 2 times, the example without missing artifacts was re-run 1 time. Builds for this plan make pretty heavy use of 'rerun failed/incomplete' due to the size and complexity of the plan.

I think the first time we saw this was 2014-09-29, when we were using 5.7-m2. I can't be sure that it didn't happen before then and we didn't notice.
fields.summary: Artifacts going missing/disappearing after "rerun failed/incomplete"

fields.description: It appears that ever since upgrading build that used to product Artifacts visible through the Artifacts tab following a build, not longer appear. Can't tell if this all the time or intermittently.
fields.summary: Since upgrading from Bamboo version 5.2 to version 5.7.1 build artifacts no longer published.

fields.description:
We received the following request from one of our Studio customers:
"see a lot information on EC2. I actually thought that Bamboo was part of Jira Studio. Now it looks as if I have to create an Amazon account (no idea what, how and where). I'd rather have seen that this was a click and run situation, which was the original idea of using Jira Studio: have everything set up to go and use without (much) reconfiguration from my side.
What are my options? Can you set up Bamboo in such a way that I can use it, or do I have to go through these hoops? Why can't I just use your account and you add the extra costs to the bills?"

The last question is fair, is it possible for us to arrange a Amazon account for all Atlassian customers to use?
fields.summary: Customer would like to use a Atlassian EC2 account instead of creating one himself

fields.description: I'd like to add a custom theme to my Bamboo OnDemand instance
fields.summary: Add theming to Bamboo OnDemand

fields.description:
Currently when configuring a BitBucket repository, I have to specify my username/password to pull code.  This ties my company's processes to my personal account, and seems like unnecessary information.

OnDemand already creates a user in my BitBucket team, it'd be great if it could use this user to pull code from BitBucket, making for better integration between OnDemand and BitBucket, and removing the necessity of providing my personal username/password into Bamboo.
fields.summary: Use OnDemand BitBucket user to pull code from repository

fields.description: Keeping in mind the actual AOD storage restrictions, a good idea is make possible to attach AWS S3 volumes to keep customers data. Bamboo and overall instance backup system can made a good usage of this feature.
fields.summary: Make possible the usage of AWS S3 volumes attached to OnDemand instance.

fields.description: Studio currently doesn't support the change-triggered build, but the corresponding option, "Repository triggers the build when changes are committed", is visible in the "Build Strategy" drop-down list. It would be nice that we either support the change-triggered build or hide the corresponding option.
fields.summary: Change-triggered build not working

fields.description:
Bamboo does not correctly close TCP sockets.  This means there are hundreds of tcp sockets in the CLOSE_WAIT state on the host and the container hits a resource allocation limit.

[jirastudio-dog][root@sdog:/]$ lsof -i | grep CLOSE | grep bamboo | wc -l
176
fields.summary: Bamboo is leaking tcp sockets to the proxy

fields.description:
The *Administering Bamboo* documentation in OnDemand space mention the *Build Expiry*, however this feature was removed from OnDemand platform.

Its possible to access the documentation on the following link:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Administering+Bamboo
fields.summary: Remove the Build Expiry mention in Administering Bamboo OnDemand documentation

fields.description: This is similar to [AOD-2753], but occurs in Bamboo.
fields.summary: Users can lock themselves out of Bamboo using Bamboo REST API

fields.description:
In some JIRA OnDemand instances there's a "Bamboo configuration" menu below *BUILDS* within the Add-ons tab, in there it displays the following:

!Bamboo configuration.png!


The message is shown even on instances where application links for Bamboo are in fact configured (either on Bamboo OnDemand or Standalone). When you click on “Click here to add one.” you are sent to the Application Links menu where you can see the actual Bamboo Application link configured. This is confusing for users and should be fixed in order to reduce friction.
fields.summary: Bamboo configuration screen under Builds inside the Add-ons tab of JIRA OnDemand shows no Bamboo application links configured

fields.description:
Deployment steps that use "Maven 3.2" are showing "No agent can build this job".

Facts:
# A compatible remote agent is available
# Remote agents are all marked as 'idle'
# This functionality was working fine yesterday.
# Have not done any reconfiguration or deployment of this task.
# Issue persists even after a reboot. 
# This is preventing all builds from completing.

Sorry - missed the screenshot where it was showing Maven 3.2 being the "required capability" that was failing.
fields.summary: "No agent can build this job" is shown even when eligible agents are idle

fields.description: Bamboo SSH plugin should allow sudo command execution with '-t' parameter. Currently, when attempting to execute sudo over SSH, deployment fails with ''vsudo: no tty present and no askpass program specified"
fields.summary: Bamboo SSH plugin should allow sudo command execution with '-t' parameter

fields.description:
When using Bamboo behind a proxy/load balancer - remote agents could fail to connect to the agent server

This occurs because the tunnel does not send a HTTP {{Host}} header as part of its request to the remote server, even when the Client Broker URL is specified as a hostname.

In this scenario, the agent exits and leave Bamboo waiting for an agent connection until the schedule cleans it up.

As a workaround a user must ensure that the load balancer will direct any requests without a {{Host}} header to Bamboo. This may require allocating a dedicated IP for Bamboo depending on the situation.

It is unclear from my end whether it is the agent or the tunnel that needs to inject the header (suspect the latter).

fields.description: I have worked on customer's instances with pages of projects, some with only a few plans, others with tens of plans and branches under each project. Dashboard filters can make the dashboard clear and the process to find a specific project faster, but when we are dealing with lots of projects distributed among different teams having an option to search the project name is very helpful.
fields.summary: Making quick search recognize project names

fields.description:
When a job gets executed it shows the correct job being executed in the plan details but the dashboard shows the previous plan number being executed.

For e.g. If I trigger build no 5 for a plan the dashboard shows build no 4 being executed.
fields.summary: Bamboo shows wrong build number being built on the dashboard

fields.description:
Hidden files are ignored by this plugin; therefore, if you have a directory path to a hidden file, the whole parent directory is copied recursively.

e.g. 

myscripts/.common-functions

would result in the entire "myscripts" directory being copied across.
fields.summary: SCP Task cannot copy hidden files

fields.description:
When you run custom build, and override variable, the plan variables are after positioned global variables, so you have scroll long long list of global variables to get there.

Before the plan variables were at the top of select. Usually there are only few plan variables so it was easy to choose the one you want override. Right now you need scroll down to find them.
fields.summary: Plan variables in variable select are positioned after global variables, unlike it was before

fields.description:
Not sure if this is purely aesthetic (drop priority if so), but choosing either build artifacts or logs has opposite effect to what is expected when viewing the current expiry plan.

1.  open Administration>Plans/Expiry
2. Click Edit
3.  check the box marked Build Artifacts
4.  Save

The description of the Expiry shows "What to expire: Build logs" instead of "Build artifacts".

5. Click Edit
6.  check the box marked Build Logs
7.  Save

The description of the Expiry shows "What to expire: Build artifacts" instead of "Build logs".
fields.summary: Expiry section shows wrong labels for what should be expired

fields.description:
When using the S3 artifact handler and clicking on links to download artifacts, the artifacts are always indiscriminately downloaded by the browser as a file.

For files that are images, HTML or other plain text types, it would be better if the browser loaded them 'inline', i.e. actually displayed the image or HTML page.

This is how the original artifact handler behaves, so it would at least be good to do for consistency aside from the added convenience.

This may mean that appropriate {{Content-disposition}} and/or {{Content-type}} headers need to be set to give the browser the right clues.
fields.summary: Allow browsing of artifacts when using the S3 artifact handler

fields.description: The new search function is very useful when looking for plans, branches and deployment project by their full names, but it will a big improvement if we can have the option to search for the "PROJKEY-PLANKEY" or "PROJKEY-PLANKEYBRANCHNUMBER" combination.
fields.summary: Using PROJKEY-PLANKEY combination to find plans

fields.description:
I have one remote agent running and I have setup 2 jobs one dependent on the other.

After the main job has finished building it triggers the child job but the child job waits in the queue for a long time even though the agent is idle.

*Is there any setting I need to change to get the agents more responsive?*
fields.summary: Dependency job is not built and waits in the queue for a long time

fields.description:
When you build a plan and the result has a lot of files (eg. 30K+), the Artifact Copier plugin fails with the error:

Failed to execute plugin 'Artifact Copier' with error: GC overhead limit exceeded

The build plan does not considder this a failure and instead says it was successfull. Since it did not publish the shared artifacts, other build and deploy jobs that are triggered automatically fail.
fields.summary: Plan successful eventhough Artifact Copier fails

fields.description:
When a build completes, the new result is not being reflected on the the build dashboard. Only by refreshing the dashboard is the new status displayed. 

This looks like a regression of BAM-13437, but in addition to the status icon not being updated, the build number is not being updated also.
fields.summary: Build status does not update on plan completion

fields.description:
I'm trying to bulk update development project environments with a new email notification - but bulk changes for development projects doesn't seem possible yet. As I have 20 different deployment projects each with 3 environments, this will be quite difficult.

In fact, it would be excellent to bulk update other aspects of development projects - including adding tasks and permissions.

Otherwise, it would be great if we could create "linked" deployment environments - most of our projects reside on the same infrastructure anyway.
fields.summary: Bulk updates to deployment projects

fields.description:
In Bamboo 5.7, when presented with the challenge "Please enter the word as shown below" and an image, the user cannot log in.

Whether they enter the correct CAPTCHA response or not, they can never log in unless an administrator resets your status.

h3. Workaround

An administrator will need to reset the user's failed login attempts by:
# going to *Administration → User Management*,
# searching for the user in question and clicking *Edit*,
# clicking *clear failed captcha attempts*.
fields.summary: CAPTCHA cannot be passed

fields.description:
I set BAMBOO_HOME in setenv.sh, when I start Bamboo I get:
{quote}
Bamboo home directory specified: . 
There was an error creating the Bamboo Home directory. The most common cause is you haven't specified it. 
To fix this, simply set the bamboo.home property in the file /WEB-INF/classes/bamboo-init.properties to your chosen bamboo home directory .
{quote}

If I set via the properties file, all is well, so the setenv.sh / environment route seems to not work?

*Resolution:* This is a duplicate of [BAM-14836|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-14836] which was created first and has more votes.  Closed in favor of that one.
fields.summary: BAMBOO_HOME environment variable not applying?

fields.description: Assuming that many customers were/are using plan labels to keep their dashboard organized, we should add a feature to quick search that allows searching for plan labels.
fields.summary: Ability to use quick search on plan labels

fields.description: it's currently not possible to find environments with the new "Quick Search" feature, it will be a great functionality to add in upcoming releases.
fields.summary: Using quick search for environments

fields.description:
Let me try and explain the scenario.

We have created 2 groups in Active Directory and configured Bamboo to only query those 2 groups (There is a possibility that my AD query may be wrong).

Bamboo returns those 2 groups but at the same time lists a lot of users who are not part of those groups.

I have set the global permissions so that only users in that group are able to create projects and I have disabled the "create" permission for the "all logged in users" group.

But here is the problem, the users from the 2 groups are not able to create new projects unless I enable the "create" permission for the "all logged in users" group.

BUT if I enable that permission then anybody in the company's Active Directoy can login and create projects in Bamboo.

We ONLY want people in the 2 groups to be able to create projects etc.

It seems like the group functionality is broken.
fields.summary: Restricting users to groups have no effect

fields.description:
One of the job failed due to the PermGerm error and it looked as if it was hung.

I manually clicked the "Stop Build" button and the job didn't stop on time and I had to eventually restart the agent.
fields.summary: Jobs do not abort immediately when they are stopped

fields.description:
I have noticed that builds cannot be queued if a build is already running.

This is one of the basic feature which seem to be missing from Bamboo as it supported in one form or the other on other CI servers.

We have more than 500 developers working on various projects and they keep on churning code and the jobs are either triggered manually or triggered automatically via the CI server.

A user *CANNOT* sit in front of the screen and wait for the current build to complete before he can trigger the job manually.

A user should be able to queue his / her job and continue with the next task.

*Unfortunately lack of such features is proving very difficult to get the developers to move away from Hudson and start using Bamboo*

I have marked this job as Critical citing my reasons as mention above
fields.summary: Cannot queue builds if the build is already running

fields.description:
I'm running Bamboo:
Continuous integration powered by Atlassian Bamboo version 5.7.0 build 5714 - 06 Nov 14

We have close to 20 plans under one project. I would like to build all plans when one "main" plan builds. My idea was to implement this with plan dependencies.

When selecting dependencies for "main" I can only see 10 plans and I am not able to attach more than 10 dependencies. Select box always brings the same 10 plans to list.
fields.summary: Cannot assign more than 10 plan dependencies

fields.description:
{quote}
This job can only be built by agents whose capabilities meet the \{0\} requirement below.{quote}
fields.summary: Message pattern not replaced on jobs requirement page

fields.description:
For customers with a large number of builds it may be beneficial to provide a annotated build number similar to other build systems. 

For example, the Build Summary page may have #46, but it may be beneficial for customers to be able to see #46-CORE-223 or similar information.
fields.summary: Ability to configure build numbers on Build Summary page

fields.description:
Hello,
In the futur, we want give more autonomous to development team. we want to delegate some administration acts to the "release manager" on a specific project.
On this plan the "release manager" must be able to manage all projects plans :
- add/modify/remove repository
- add/modify/remove Permissions
- add/modify/remove the Stages/jobs/stages
- add/modify/remove Triggers
- add/modify/remove Permissions
- add/modify/remove Notifications
- add/modify/remove Variables
- add/modify/remove Miscellaneous

all actions should be tracked in a audit log as stath.
Like that, we can delegate some administration acts with some controls.
best regards,
Fabien
fields.summary: Plan Permission management && audit log
Bamboo cannot checkout submodules from Git (GitHub Enterprise)

fields.description:
Bamboo currently ignores the settings.xml configured under the user's default home folder under OSX.

I had to copy the settings.xml into each of the maven installation configuration folder to get it to work.

This is not a ideal solution

But this works fine under Linux without me having to copy the configuration files across.

It also works with Hudson under OSX.
fields.summary: Bamboo does not pick up settings.xml from the user's .m2 folder under OSX

fields.description:
When a build is stopped when the code checkout is in progress the build just hangs.

And the only way to recover from this is to restart the agent.

I am not sure if reducing the command timeout value from the default 180 mins is the solution but this is one setting which the developers are going to forget to change and will end up me having to restart the agents all the time.

Currently there is no option (AFAICS) to set a default command timeout or an option to bulk edit all the plans.
fields.summary: Build hangs when the build is checking out code

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Bamboo hang or unresponsive if there is an Application Link with JIRA

h3. Problem
JIRA dashboard with unauthenticated Bamboo gadgets will make a call to /plugins/servlet/oauth/request-token generating a new entry (token for authentication request) in Bandana table for every request to every gadget.

In case of JIRA dashboard with 5 gadgets refreshed every 15 minutes for 5 users it gives 100 new records per hour. OAuth library is aware of this issue and contains ExpiredSessionRemover which is run every 8 hours and should clean expired tokens. We are verifying right now if this job is being run in Bamboo and if it actually clears expired records. This ticket will be updated based on our findings and recent updates regarding the issue.

h3. Notes
Getting thread dumps shows that Bamboo is busy getting data from database due to OAuth:

h3.Workaround
Disable Bamboo Gadget in JIRA server:
# Navigate to {{Bamboo Administration >> Add-ons >> Manage add-ons >> System add-ons}}
# Disable “Atlassian Bamboo gadgets plugin”
# Restart JIRA server because JIRA server cache Bamboo gadget connection details
Bamboo gadget in JIRA server should be disabled now. The gadget will have the following message:
{quote}
This gadget cannot be displayed on your dashboard. This could be due to a licensing problem or an application error. If you need this gadget, contact your administrator for assistance. Otherwise, you can remove it from your dashboard.
{quote}
# Restart Bamboo to clear the current connections
fields.summary: Performance issue caused by unauthenticated Bamboo gadgets on JIRA dashboard

fields.description:
When triggering a build from JIRA the build is queued but eventually times out.

The following appears in the Bamboo log.
{code}
2014-11-19 08:41:19,936 INFO [bambooAgentMessageListenerConnector-1] [DefaultErrorHandler] Recording an error: Unknown exception occurred on 'AGENT'. Agent will attempt to recover its normal operation... : All Builds : Could not resolve class 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.jira.release.JIRAReleaseTriggerReason' from plugin 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.jira.atlassian-bamboo-plugin-jira': Plugin not installed : Could not resolve class 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.jira.release.JIRAReleaseTriggerReason' from plugin 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.jira.atlassian-bamboo-plugin-jira': Plugin not installed
---- Debugging information ----
message             : Could not resolve class 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.jira.release.JIRAReleaseTriggerReason' from plugin 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.jira.atlassian-bamboo-plugin-jira': Plugin not installed
cause-exception     : com.atlassian.bamboo.serialization.xstream.OwningPluginNotInstalledException
cause-message       : Could not resolve class 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.jira.release.JIRAReleaseTriggerReason' from plugin 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.jira.atlassian-bamboo-plugin-jira': Plugin not installed
class               : com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.BuildContextImpl
required-type       : com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.BuildContextImpl
converter-type      : com.atlassian.bamboo.serialization.xstream.BuildContextXStreamConverter
path                : /result/value/parentBuildContext/triggerReason
line number         : 26
class[1]            : org.springframework.remoting.support.RemoteInvocationResult
converter-type[1]   : com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.ReflectionConverter
version             : not available
-------------------------------
{code}

I have checked each agent and %REMOTE-AGENT-HOME%/plugins/system-provided/atlassian-bamboo-plugin-jira-5.7.0.jar exists and is loaded during agent startup.

I have checked the agent-bootstrap-blacklist.txt as per https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/17173/builds-fail-endlessly-queued-on-any-build-triggered-by-jira and confirmed that *bamboo-plugin-jira* is nowhere in the file.

h4. Workaround:
Run build manually
fields.summary: Release build from JIRA is queued but never built.

fields.description: When a release already exists for a deployment environment, if it's selected again under the "Create Release" page, Bamboo just reloads the page, filling the "This version" box with the correct value, based on the last version. We need an error or warning that informs the user about using a redundant release name/number instead of just refreshing the page. Please see the attached screenshots. Selecting BranchAvvali-1 in 2 causes a page refresh instead of showing a warning that the release already exists.
fields.summary: Selecting an existing release should show a warning instead of a page reload

fields.description:
Need the ability for a deployment to block another deployment; particularly where both deployments might have to restart the same backend process on the same server when they run.

At present, we're working round this with a lock file, but perhaps bamboo could create a lock object as part of the deployment (storing as a variable)?
fields.summary: Deployment dependencies
Script Task needs debug output in build log

h3. Symptoms

Spot Instances in VPC are not getting a public IP, agents are stuck at pending state and eventually die.

h3. Workaround
Disable spot instance and use non-spot instance instead.

fields.description:
Previously Bamboo would run an "upgrade -forced" against Grails projects where it detected the version of the project was lower. 

As of Grails 2.4, the upgrade command has been removed, resulting in the return of: "Script 'Upgrade' not found, did you mean:" and several manual options. 

Compatibility with Grails 2.4.X is needed.
fields.summary: Bamboo runs incompatible upgrade command against Grails 2.4.

fields.description:
As of today (Nov 17th), after Bamboo's upgrade to 5.7, users are currently unable to start *EC2* instances with an EBS volume attached to them. Even though the EC2 instance has an EBS volume attached, Bamboo keeps searching for a snapshot ID. It fails with the following error message:

{noformat}
2014-11-17 15:05:18,884 ERROR [elastic-pool-4-thread-1] [RemoteEC2InstanceImpl] EC2 instance order failed.
com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException: The snapshot ID 'vol-f4a60dec' does not exist (Service: AmazonEC2; Status Code: 400; Error Code: InvalidSnapshotID.NotFound; Request ID: 6d98e595-e0fc-4d
67-a756-0935492b34a7)
        at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.handleErrorResponse(AmazonHttpClient.java:1053)
        at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.executeOneRequest(AmazonHttpClient.java:662)
        at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.executeHelper(AmazonHttpClient.java:428)
        at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.execute(AmazonHttpClient.java:290)
        at com.amazonaws.services.ec2.AmazonEC2Client.invoke(AmazonEC2Client.java:9225)
        at com.amazonaws.services.ec2.AmazonEC2Client.runInstances(AmazonEC2Client.java:4382)
        at com.atlassian.aws.ec2.InstanceLauncherFactory$AwsInstanceLauncher.call(InstanceLauncherFactory.java:129)
        at com.atlassian.aws.ec2.RemoteEC2InstanceImpl.launchInstance(RemoteEC2InstanceImpl.java:460)
        at com.atlassian.aws.ec2.RemoteEC2InstanceImpl.backgroundStart(RemoteEC2InstanceImpl.java:443)
        at com.atlassian.aws.ec2.RemoteEC2InstanceImpl.access$200(RemoteEC2InstanceImpl.java:39)
        at com.atlassian.aws.ec2.RemoteEC2InstanceImpl$1.run(RemoteEC2InstanceImpl.java:103)
        at com.atlassian.aws.ec2.RemoteEC2InstanceImpl$CatchingRunnableDecorator.run(RemoteEC2InstanceImpl.java:83)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:441)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:98)
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:206)

        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)

Looking at the error message we can see that it's trying to find a snapshot with ID 'vol-f4a60dec', but this is not a snapshot ID, it's an EBS volume.

Create a snapshot from the EBS volume inside AWS and use the snapshot ID in Bamboo while this is not resolved.

fields.description:
Larger log files can cause Performance issues when Bamboo tries to open those files on the Logs tab of the Build Result screen. Multiple attempts to open the log result in multiple threads being opened, causing elevated CPU usage and slow overall response. 

In Bamboo OnDemand the extended delay to open the Logs tab may lead to the UI timing out, but a thread remains opened in the background. The page timeout leads to users refreshing the page, causing a new thread to be opened and further degrading performance.

*Steps to Replicate*
# Create or edit an existing log file within the Bamboo filesystem so it has a larger size. Sizes bigger than 500MB seem to result in problems. You can use a brief perl scrip to populate the file (perl -e 'print "a" x 600000000' > logfile.log).
# While monitoring the server performance indicators go to the UI and try to open the Logs tab of that build result. CPU usage quickly goes up while the log is being rendered. Refreshing the page makes the problem worse as a new thread is opened.

*Workaround*
* Bamboo Server users can go to filesystem and remove the log files manually. The logs will be located in the following path within the Bamboo Home folder, replace the build name accordingly:  */xml-data/builds/BUILD-TEST-JOB1/download-data/build_logs/BUILD-TEST-JOB1-10.log*
* For Bamboo OnDemand customers who believe they are facing this problem, please raise a ticket at https://support.atlassian.com so we can make those log files available for you and then cleanup those from the filesystem.
fields.summary: Opening Large Log Files Within the Logs Tab of the Build Result Screen Can Result in Timeouts and Performance Issues

fields.description:
Reported by customer on 5.6.2:
{quote}
Steps to reproduce:
1) create a new plan
2) in plan configuration -> Variables tab: add a new variable
Variable name: my_var	
Value: true
3) in the default job add a bash script with the following:
coin_flip=$(( ( RANDOM % 2 ) + 1 ))
echo "Number is.....: $coin_flip"
if [ $((coin_flip%2)) -eq 0 ]; then
echo "even number. pass the build."
echo "my_var is....: $bamboo_my_var"
exit 0
else
echo "odd number. lets error"
exit 1
fi
4) create a related deployment job.
5) add a environment (prod)
6) in edit tasks add a bash script with the following.
if [ -z "$bamboo_my_var" ]; then
echo "my_var is not set!"
echo "looks like a retry build being deployed bug!"
exit 1
else
echo "all good!"
echo "my_var is set to: $bamboo_my_var"
echo "Lucky the build being deployed wasnt a build which has retry!"
exit 0
fi
7) now run a build till you get a failed build.
8) once you get a failed build run retry failed/incompleted jobs only
run that till it passes.
9) go to the deployment for that project.
select deploy -> prod
select create new release from build result.
select the last build (which was a retried build)
click start deploy.
you will notice the bamboo_my_var value not being set.
and the deploy will fail.
if you do the same for a successful build which wasnt a retry you will get your custom variable and it will exit correctly.
{quote}

I was able to reproduce this on Bamboo 5.7 as well
fields.summary: Deployments lose variables for rerun failed builds

fields.description:
The problem can be recreated using a task (e.g. NAnt, Maven, etc) and passing in a parameter whose value includes a space:

{code:title=NAnt}
Options = -v -D:build.number=${bamboo.buildNumber} -D:nunit.path="C:\Program Files (x86)\NUnit 2.6.3\bin\nunit-console.exe"
{code}

{code:title=Maven}
Maven goal = -Dtest.password="${bamboo.test.password}"
{code}

Bamboo is incorrectly parsing the options and causing the arguments to be called without the enclosing double quotes.

h5. How about using single quotes?

One can try to workaround the problem trying to use single quotes instead of double quotes, like in the example below:

{code:title=NAnt (Using singles quotes}
-D:arg.option='foo' -D:arg.whitespace='foo and bar' -D:nunit.path='C:\Program Files (x86)\NUnit 2.6.3\bin\nunit-console.exe' -D:build.number=${bamboo.buildNumber}
{code}

The problem is that the build fails with single quotes because Bamboo ends up adding the quotes as extra characters to the variable value, and if it changes the value it cannot be reliable, see the following examples:

{code:title=testNUnit.build}
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<project name="testNUnit">
	<target name="run">
		<echo message="hello world" />
		<echo message="${arg.option}" />
		<echo message="${arg.whitespace}" />
		<echo message="${nunit.path}" />
		<echo message="${build.number}" />
	</target>
</project>
{code}

fields.description:
We are using the Gradle Wrapper task from the Bob Swift Groovy plugin and we are seeing a strange issue we think is because of the way system properties are handled by Bamboo.

The problem is that a system property set in the Bamboo server (a property that is used to configure the Stash SSL connection) is also set in the JVM that the gradle task runs in. So we suspect that Bamboo takes all system properties from the bamboo server and sets it on the agent JVM.
Note that this happens on local agents running on the same server as the bamboo server.

Is this a feature in Bamboo, and how can we work around it? Is it possible to disable it?
fields.summary: Bamboo sets bamboo server jvm args on gradle vm

fields.summary: LDAP authentication fails with NPE

fields.description:
Bamboo fail to link JIRA issue from commit message if the key is led and/or followed by dash "-". This however doesn't affect if it is not dash e.g. underscore "_".

Examples of commit messages which the issue won't be linked to the build:
* ABC-123-commit message
* Commit message-ABC-123
* Commit message-ABC-123-committing

Also see BAM-14213:
{quote}
When there is a merge in git the comment mentions the branch name. Bamboo would then show it on its dashboard like this
{code}
Code Changes
	somebody
Merge branch 'IB-12.34.567' of http://someurl/repos/somerepo into IB-12.34.567
{code}

If the branch name seems to follow a jira key pattern bamboo wrongly identifies it as a jira ticket, setting the underlink, trying to communicate with jira looking for details on this in-existing ticket, etc. In the case above bamboo would identify IB-12 as a jira ticket.

Bamboo should be able to let configure which strings patterns are not to be taken as jira tickets.
{quote}
fields.summary: Bamboo fail to link JIRA issue from commit message if the key is led and/or followed by dash "-"

fields.summary: Disable deployments button on builds for anonymous users

fields.description:
SVN checkout is extremely slow from Bamboo after upgrading from 5.1.0 to 5.6.2.

Manually performing an SVN checkout on the same server takes about 5 minutes to check out 1.3GB of code but Bamboo is taking a long time to perform the same checkout:

- Checkout time using svnkit 1.7.13: 4:20
- Checkout time using svnkit 1.8.6: 8:35
- Checkout time using native client: 1:45
- Checkout time using Bamboo: 55:42

The SVN server is CollabNet Subversion 1.7.9
The SVN client installed on the build server is CollabNet 1.7.11

This has proved to be a bug in the third-party SVNKit library: http://issues.tmatesoft.com/issue/SVNKIT-553

Some tweaks that might help:
* Using [SVN Export|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Subversion]
* Setting the working copy format to 1.6 (Navigate to: Administration > Repository settings > Subversion (tab))
fields.summary: SVN checkout slow after upgrading from 5.1.0 to 5.6.2

fields.description:
Setup: have a plan which has previously built. Do not enable concurrent builds.

Select the most recent build of an plan. Make the plan start to build e.g. commit to the repository. Press run plan. An error is displayed that the build can't be displayed.
fields.summary: Starting a build while another build is in progress displays a confusing error message.

fields.summary: Sometimes deleting plans does not work

fields.description:
Reader comment:
"This looks nice in theory but I don't see much info on how to make it actually work as diagrammed.  That is, how to set up different deployments for different branches.  An example would be nice.  An example demonstrated on video would be nicer.  Especially, an example showing how to set up an entire git-flow model (since you support git-flow in SourceTree) and how to deploy differently from develop versus master, etc.

Update: after toying around, I figured some of this out (sort of), but better examples and explanations are still needed.  I see how to trigger auto deployments by main versus custom branch but I don't see any way to limit certain deploys to certain branches (such as limiting the production deploy to the main branch).  Such a feature may not be stated but it seems implied."

See https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Deployments+from+branches?focusedCommentId=686853427#comment-686853427
fields.summary: Improve the CAC 'Deployments from branches' page

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to run a deployment as a "dry run" to see what changes would actually be made.

Some ideas about how this might work in practice:

- Deployment tasks have an "include in dry run" checkbox. If it's not checked, the task won't run at all in a dry run
- Deployment tasks have a "Dry Run" variable and an "Commit" variable value. At runtime, the appropriate value fills ${bamboo.dryrun} so it can be passed to the appropriate script
- Create a new button "Start dry run" on deploy/selectVersionForExecute.action
- Running a deployment in "Dry Run" does not update the "current" release of an environment

Obviously it will be up to the developer to integrate the flag correctly with the tools.
fields.summary: Support dry runs for deployment projects

fields.description: Currently a user can only specify the location of an SSH key local to an agent for Subversion.  We don't want to have to store SSH keys on agents (as this is not secure, and is not a good model when there are many accounts and SSH keys), and would like to be able to attach an SSH key to a plan similar to the way Git repositories are configured with SSH.  Please provide the facility to attach an SSH key to a plan for Subversion.
fields.summary: Add ability to attach SSH key to plan's subversion repository configuration

fields.description:
Hello,

in a plugin I develop I want to iterate over plan repositories and read Stash sepcific data from the repository object.
That is currently not possible until you add com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.stash to Export-Package the plugins pom.xml.

I dont see any other way to retrieve Stash repository details from a Bamboo plan.
fields.summary: Please export StashRepository from atlassian-bamboo-plugin-stash plugin
Make the Convert to linked repository task configurable as a bulk action

fields.description: Similar to GIT type repository, provide options for user to select authentication method for STASH type repos rather than automatically creating SSH keys for all STASH linked repositories, with the convenience of selecting repository from dropdown menu.
fields.summary: Provide options for authentication method for "STASH" type repositories

(/) testDivide

(/) testConcat
fields.summary: Display testsuite separately under Tests tab

fields.description:
When bamboo disables a plan because it has an issue with the repository this action not flagged to the user, although reported in the audit logs. This can go unnoticed on a busy system. 

An good improvement would be to have this reported as a system notice, or better, an notification that can be used to message users.
fields.summary: Trigger a notification when a plan is disabled by Bamboo

fields.description:
It would be very helpful if Bamboo would automatically route jobs or add some sort of capability/requirement to jobs based on the script task interpreter to make sure they get executed in the right place (e.g. Windows or Linux). This is to avoid a situation where, for instance, a job with script task executing a batch file is sent to a remote agent running on Linux.

At the moment Bamboo sends those jobs to any available agent unless you work with (a) [agent dedication|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/dedicating-an-agent-629015108.html] and/or (b) [requirements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo0609/administering-bamboo/agents-and-capabilities/configuring-capabilities/about-capabilities-and-requirements]. This can become troublesome and difficult to maintain in large Bamboo deployments.
fields.summary: Automatic routing of jobs to agents in different OS platforms based on the script task interpreter

fields.description: A new installation directory is created for each Bamboo upgrade, so settings added to setenv.sh and server.xml files sitting under installation directory don't get transferred to the new instance. This causes a variety of issues and it'll be great if we can have a warning message when opening the new upgraded instance for the first time that checks if these settings are manually transferred, or better if there is a way to handle this in the upgrade process.
fields.summary: Warning to transfer installation directory config files information after upgrade

fields.description:
How to reproduce it:
10 local agents, plan with 2 stages:
- stage A: 1 job, sleep 20s
- stage B: 8 jobs, sleep 60s

Run plan and observe that when stage B starts only subset of jobs will run immediately thought there are available agents
fields.summary: Builds not picked up by agents when multiple builds hit the queue at the same time.
